Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • Client
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChatBot, ChatClient, DoDClient
    public abstract class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the connection process of a client to the server, required variables to read/write to the server and their initialisation/closures methods. It is abstract as ChatClients, ChatBots and DoDClients are all types of clients and so they inherit from Client.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected java.io.BufferedReader serverIn
      BufferedReader which reads the text from the server.
      protected java.io.PrintWriter serverOut
      PrintWriter which writes text to the server.
      protected java.net.Socket socket
      Socket representing the client side endpoint for communication between the client and server.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Client​(java.lang.String consoleAddress, java.lang.String consolePort)
      The constructor initialises userInput, socket (after validation), serverIn and serverOut.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected void cleanShutDown()  
      protected abstract SenderType clientType()
      Abstract method which will return the type of the client
      protected void closeReader()
      Closes the serverIn BufferedReader
      protected void closeSocket()
      Closes the socket Socket
      protected void closeUserInput()
      Closes the userInput BufferedReader
      private void closeWriter()
      Closes the serverOut PrintWriter
      private void connectToServer​(java.lang.String address, java.lang.String portString)
      Attempts connecting to the server given the address and portString supplied.
      abstract void go()
      Abstract method which will be called once the client is initialised
      private void initialiseReadWrite()
      Initialises the serverIn BufferedReader and the serverOut PrintWriter
      protected void initialiseSocketConnection​(java.lang.String consoleAddress, java.lang.String consolePort)
      Initialises the connection to the server in a while loop, so by the end of this method, a connection is established.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client​(java.lang.String consoleAddress,
              java.lang.String consolePort)
        The constructor initialises userInput, socket (after validation), serverIn and serverOut.
        Parameters:
        consoleAddress - String representing the address entered into the console (default is "localhost" if none was entered)
        consolePort - String representing the port number entered into the console (default is "14001" if none was entered)

    • Method Detail

      • initialiseSocketConnection

        protected void initialiseSocketConnection​(java.lang.String consoleAddress,
                                          java.lang.String consolePort)
        Initialises the connection to the server in a while loop, so by the end of this method, a connection is established.
        Parameters:
        consoleAddress - String representing the address entered into the console (default is "localhost" if none was entered)
        consolePort - String representing the port number entered into the console (default is "14001" if none was entered)

      • connectToServer

        private void connectToServer​(java.lang.String address,
                             java.lang.String portString)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Attempts connecting to the server given the address and portString supplied.
        Parameters:
        address - String representing the address supplied
        portString - String representing the port supplied
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If address supplied does not contain a host or if port supplied does not contain a server
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If port supplied is not an integer between 1024 and 65535 inclusive

      • initialiseReadWrite

        private void initialiseReadWrite()
        Initialises the serverIn BufferedReader and the serverOut PrintWriter

        Abstract method which will be called once the client is initialised
